exam.question: Many manufacturers were accused of concentrating too heavily on cost reduction, often at the ______ of the quality of their products.

answer.explain: at the expense of： 以…为代价。句意： 许多制造商都因为过分注重降低成本却常以牺牲产品质量为代价而受到控告。expansion： 扩充； expectation： 期待； exposure： 暴露。

sentences.sContent: He borrowed £150,000 and used the money for legal expenses.
sentences.sCn: 他借了15万英镑用于支付律师费。

sentences.sContent: Conference rooms were equipped at great expense.
...but too often at the expense of a connection with the present and future world beyond...

...universities are "catering to the social and educational needs of wealthy students at the expense of others" who won't enjoy the financial backing or social connections of richer students once they graduate...
...We do not doubt that teachers who also coach face serious tradeoffs that likely come at the expense of time they could dedicate to their academic obligations...
...the additional responsibilities that come with coaching likely come at the expense of time otherwise spent on planning...
...but certainly distorts the price of corn- at the expense of many of the world's poorest people...
...They argue that when a company like Monsanto goes to great expense to create a valuable new genetically modified seed...
...some couples don't have children because they don't want to sacrifice their own lifestyles to the time and expense of a family...
...The company will also be able to avoid the expense of having to relocate staff to temporary offices for several weeks when it begins disruptive office renovations soon...

phrases.pCn: n. 利息费用，利息支出
经营费用；营业费用；事业费
营业费用；企业管理费用

remMethod.val: ex(出去) ＋ pens(花费) ＋ e → 花费， 消费

words.tran: 可消费的；排出的；不重复使用的；可牺牲的

trans.tranCn: 花费， 消费， 费用； 开支， 业务费用
trans.tranOther: the amount of money that you spend on something
